other_tests.findings: Sinus tachycardia with right-axis deviation and low voltage in the limb leads.
Large, circumferential pericardial effusion with evidence of tamponade, a right-sided pleural effusion, and an edematous-appearing aortic root.
other_tests.changes_over_time: LVEF improved from 40% before the procedure to 65-70% after the procedure.

other_tests.findings: Echogenic material and circumferential involvement of the pericardium, aorta, and main pulmonary artery with stenosis of at least three pulmonary veins.
Prominent thickening of the walls of the ascending aorta and the main pulmonary artery and narrowed pulmonary veins; thrombus present in the left atrial appendage and right atrium.

Multiple foci of malignant-tumor deposits in the subarachnoid space.
Similar malignant cells to those seen in the mediastinal and pericardial biopsies.
